file_content.text: I remember now why I spent so little time outside my laboratories.
Doctor Godera, are you alright? I'm a Jedi Knight sent by General Var Suthra to rescue you.
Var Suthra? That old man never gives up, does he?
All I remember was being knocked unconscious in my lab. At least the Imperials couldn't question me.
The Imperials gave me a class-four truth serum. Don't remember the interrogation, but I fear they learned too much.
I suppose you plan to take me back to Coruscant? I left for a good reason, you know.
I'd like to hear it.
Tell me why.
The Republic doomed itself when we signed that blasted treaty.
We need you, doctor. The Republic is endangered.
Circumstances have changed.
It's been endangered since that idiotic treaty.
The Sith Empire only sought a strategic pause in the fighting; time to gather strength for a final crushing blow.
The Senate ignored my projections. I refuse to serve such monumental ignorance.
The Republic needed time to regain strength, too. So did the Jedi.
We needed peace.
Hmph. And are we ready to finish this war, or will we sit back while the Empire devours the galaxy?
A government founded on freedom of choice is going to make mistakes. But it can also correct them.
Democracy isn't perfect.
I hope the fools who were in power when I left have been voted out of office.
The Republic leaders are fools. We never should have backed down from the Sith.
I understand completely.
Peace with the Empire is impossible. The evidence surrounds us.
If it hasn't started already, all-out war is imminent. I'm ready to face what's coming.
Your motives aren't my concern. My job is to deliver you safely.
I don't care--let's go.
No choice, hmm? Things must be bad. I told the Senate that treaty would never last.
Perhaps it is time I returned... finish the war and wipe out the Empire for good.
It's impolite to stare.
